item.title: Roblox Player Performs Speedrunning Forensics To Uncover Fraud And Win Back World Record
item.content:encoded:
A player who goes by Quinten was on their way to securing a Guinness World Record in Roblox when they were beat out at the last moment by multiple speedruns that were so good, they seemed humanly impossible. A lesser player might have gone back to gambling on the Roblox ponies, but Quinten instead set out to prove that the new records were bogus. It worked.

As PCGamesN reports, Quinten was competing for the world record in a Roblox game called Ultimate Easy Obby that has over 100,000 reviews. It‚Äôs a zany, single-player obstacle course similar to something you might find in Fall Guys and was published by Roblox in partnership with the Guinness World Record company. Last month, Quinten secured a time of 05:48:96 following an ‚Äúinsane back-and-forth battle‚Äù with another Roblox speedrunner. It was the result of tons of time spent ‚Äúoptimizing every corner and jump,‚Äù the 18-year-old Belgian wrote on Reddit.

But then something bizarre happened. Quinten‚Äôs speedrun record was quickly beaten by three other random Roblox accounts. And not just by a little bit but six whole seconds. ‚ÄúFor context: a 6-second gap on a speedrun this optimized is physically impossible,‚Äù they wrote. ‚ÄúIt was heartbreaking to see a week of grinding ruined by scripts.‚Äù Undeterred, Quinten decided to speedrun an investigation into the mysterious rivals to find proof of the suspected cheating.

This evidence fell into three main buckets. The first was bogus time stamps. Ultimate Easy Obby features a linear obstacle course consisting of 50 stages, but some of the mystery accounts‚Äô timestamps were out of order. The new world record holder was also missing a ‚Äúdigital receipt‚Äù of ever having actually completed the race. ‚ÄúThis proved he never actually touched the finish line trigger; he likely teleported a coordinate script to the end-game lobby, bypassing the verification check,‚Äù Quinten wrote.

But the real nail in the coffin was painstaking frame-by-frame analysis of Quinten‚Äôs own best recorded time to show that shaving six seconds off it would be impossible. ‚ÄúI took my best run and calculated the theoretical maximum time save possible (perfect pixels, zero drag),‚Äù they wrote. ‚ÄúEven with a TAS (Tool-Assisted Speedrun) level of perfection, the times the cheaters posted were mathematically impossible within the game‚Äôs physics engine.‚Äù

Surprisingly, it all worked. The evidence was submitted to Guinness which then went back, reviewed the records, and re-validated Quinten‚Äôs as the true World Record. ‚ÄúIt felt amazing to successfully lobby a major organization to reverse verified records based on user-submitted digital forensics,‚Äù they wrote. The king of Ultimate Easy Obby can once again rest easy knowing at least one more small sliver of fraud has been carved out of Roblox.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Kicks Off 2026 With Two Massive Games
item.content:encoded:
While the first two games added to Xbox Game Pass in January might not knock your socks off, it‚Äôs what‚Äôs coming later this month that should bring some New Year cheer. By January 13, Game Pass subscribers will have access to Ubisoft‚Äôs enormously underrated Star Wars Outlaws, and just a week later the stunning Resident Evil Village brings our favorite tall lady to the service.

Added today, January 6, are drunken twin-stick shooter Brews & Bastards (no, me neither, but I‚Äôll be installing it this evening) and Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition. Then as soon as tomorrow, last year‚Äôs underdog first-person action game Atomfall will be added to the subscription platform, alongside 2025 roguelite sequel Lost in Random: The Eternal Die, online multiplayer soccer sim Rematch, and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine‚Äòs Master Crafted Edition, hopefully now fixed from all its many issues on launch.

Then, but another day later, we get the original Final Fantasy in its 2024 ‚Äúremodeled‚Äù version, seemingly plucked from the Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster bundle.

You‚Äôll have to somehow wait another five days, until January 13, before the next update, when Star Wars Outlaws arrives, and hopefully a whole new raft of people can discover this fantastic open-galaxy criminal ‚Äôem up, after it suffered from both a buggy launch and a concerted anti-woke campaign from the worst people on the internet. Seriously, if you were put off by any of the noise during its 2024 release, this is a great chance to put that right. The stealth is so much better now.

After My Little Pony: A Zephyr Heights Mystery shows up Jan 15, on the 20th arrives Lady Dimitrescu in her size 25s via 2021‚Äôs Resident Evil Village, alongside metroidvania platformer MIO: Memories in Orbit, a day-one release.

Microsoft giveth, but Microsoft taketh away, so to get all these new games we must sacrifice a bunch too. I don‚Äôt imagine too many tears will be shed over the five titles going away on January 15, however, all listed below. Here‚Äôs everything in one handy, bullet-pointed list:

January 6

  • Brews & Bastards (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)
  • Little Nightmares Enhanced Edition (Cloud, Handheld, PC, Xbox Series)

January 7

  • Atomfall (Cloud, Console, Handheld, PC)
  • Lost in Random: The Eternal Die (Cloud, Xbox Series, Handheld, PC)
  • Rematch (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine ‚Äì Master Crafted Edition (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series)

January 8

  • Final Fantasy (Cloud, Xbox Series, PC)

January 15

  • My Little Pony: A Zephyr Heights Mystery (Cloud, Console, Handheld, PC)

January 20

Resident Evil Village (Cloud, Console, PC)

MIO: Memories in Orbit (Cloud, Handheld, PC, Xbox Series)

Leaving January 15

  • Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn (Cloud, Handheld, PC, and Xbox Series X|S)
  • Neon White (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC)
  • Road 96 (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC)
  • The Ascent (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC)
  • The Grinch Christmas Adventures (Cloud, Console, Handheld, and PC)

A powerful yet compact portable charger

This is a powerful and compact portable charger that lets you charge several electronic devices simultaneously. That makes it a great pick for cell phones, tablets, game consoles, and more. It provides up to 160W of power through each of its USB-C ports, so it can safely and rapidly fast-charge a USB-C laptop while charging two additional devices (phone and/or tablet) at the same time.

The USB-C ports are ideal for providing high-power charging to newer laptops, tablets and smartphones, while the USB-A ports are ideal for charging older phones, Bluetooth speakers and/or other smaller electronic devices. Additionally, the Anker Prime Charger has Power Delivery (PD) capability, enabling it to supply power to your electronic devices at the fastest possible rate, allowing you to charge your devices quicker and more efficiently.

Although the Anker Prime Charger has the potential to deliver a significant amount of power, it‚Äôs still super small. You can put it on a desktop surface, nightstand, or kitchen counter without taking up too much valuable real estate. It‚Äôs also super lightweight and easily storable in a backpack or travel case, making it ideal for use during business trips, vacations, or work-from-home/coworking days, when users would prefer a single charger to replace a tangled mess of individual chargers and cables.

Built-in safety features enable you to feel confident when connecting expensive electronic devices. The Anker Prime Charger constantly monitors temperature and power consumption to ensure that it protects against heat damage (overheating), excessive voltage, and/or electrical shock due to short circuit conditions. Although these protective mechanisms operate transparently, they offer considerable peace-of-mind benefits when you need to charge multiple high-value devices at the same time.

This Anker Prime Charger is absolutely perfect for its size, capacity, and performance. It eliminates clutter, enables fast-charging capabilities for newer devices, and is compatible with both home and travel-based environments. Bottom line? You should get one and keep it in your bag, car, or somewhere else that you use often in case of emergencies. You never know when you might get struck with a charging emergency.

item.title: I‚Äôm Begging For A Sequel After Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles Ships 1 Million Copies
item.content:encoded:
How many more copies does Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles need to sell before Square Enix greenlights a new grid-based strategy RPG? Almost three years later, physical versions of Hi-Fi Rush are finally up for pre-order. And how long will it take for Netflix to turn Arc Raiders into its next streaming hit?

It‚Äôs the latest edition of Morning Checkpoint, Kotaku‚Äòs daily roundup of gaming news and culture. Depending on what you‚Äôre into, January will probably feel like a slow month for big new game releases, at least compared to last year. But I‚Äôm getting lowkey hyped for Code Vein 2, the follow-up to the messy 2019 action-RPG anime soulslike. This one has a motorcycle.

Even Final Fantasy Tactics‚Äò original director can‚Äôt believe how well the remaster is selling

I underestimated the sales figures by too much.üòÇüòÇüòÇ

‚Äî ÊùæÈáéÊ≥∞Â∑±üêà‚Äç‚¨õ (@YasumiMatsuno) January 6, 2026

Square Enix revealed that Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles has sold over 1 million copies. That might be ‚Äúbelow expectations‚Äù for the infamously disappointed Japanese publisher, but it was enough to take Yasumi Matsuno by surprise. It also prompted a fresh message to fans from the remaster‚Äôs director.

‚ÄúThe entire development team is not only grateful to you, but, in order to spread the joy, create a better experience, and encourage more people to play, we are looking at updating the game in the future!‚Äù Kazutoyo Maehiro wrote, according to a translation from Gamesradar. What does updating the game in the future entail, exactly? Could the missing War of the Lions content be officially restored? Could we get fresh end-game modes?

‚ÄúOur first and foremost goal here really was to recreate the original game,‚Äù Maehiro told Wired last year. ‚ÄúIf [The Ivalice Chronicles] were to become a success,‚Äù he continued, ‚ÄúI do feel that that would then lead to discussions around potentially bringing out sequels, for example, or newer tactical RPGs.‚Äù

Let the Final Fantasy Tactics 2 summoning circle commence.

You can finally pre-order a physical copy of Hi-Fi Rush

The 2023 GOTY contender from Tango Gameworks, a studio that Microsoft closed in 2024 but which was later re-opened under Krafton, is finally getting a physical version that you can start pre-ordering from Limited Run Games on January 23. That includes a PS5 version. This is one game everyone should have in their collection, even if it could still be a year before it actually starts shipping.

We could end up getting an Arc Raiders TV show

Embark studio head Patrick S√∂derlund told GamesBeat that Hollywood is interested and so is he. ‚ÄúWe [wouldn‚Äôt] mind doing that. It would be fun, but it needs to be done in the right way. I hope that we will do that. I think the IP fits quite well with something like that.‚Äù Nothing is set in stone yet, however, and Embark doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúhave anyone working on a TV or film adaptation yet.‚Äù Maybe we‚Äôll see it on Netflix in time for Arc Raiders 2.

Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner was fine with her ending

She acknowledges that the rest of the cast was disappointed with their characters‚Äô fates. ‚ÄúBut I feel that I was very happy with the way Sansa ended her story in Game of Thrones, and no one else was really happy with their ending,‚Äù Turner told The Direct. ‚ÄúI feel like I got a good one, and so I don‚Äôt know if I could revisit it.‚Äù Would she come back to do more Game of Thrones? ‚ÄúShow me the money,‚Äù she joked. She might be too busy with Tomb Raider anyway.

Final Fantasy 9‚Äòs character artist says goodbye

Toshiyuki Itahana left Square Enix at the end of last year. ‚ÄúLast year marked a major milestone with the 25th anniversary of FINAL FANTASY IX, a truly significant event, and I was deeply grateful to see so many people celebrating FFIX,‚Äù he wrote in a message to fans. He‚Äôll continue to produce art as a freelance illustrator.
